questions.question: When $2x^3 + 3x^2 - 5x + 1$ is divided by $(x+2)$, find the quotient.
questions.explanation: Using polynomial long division or synthetic division: $2x^3 + 3x^2 - 5x + 1 = (x+2)(2x^2 - x - 3) + 7$. The quotient is $2x^2 - x - 3$.

questions.question: The polynomial $P(x) = x^3 + ax^2 + bx + 8$ has $(x-2)$ and $(x+1)$ as factors. Find the value of $a + b$.
questions.explanation: $P(2) = 0$: $8 + 4a + 2b + 8 = 0$, so $4a + 2b = -16$ or $2a + b = -8$. $P(-1) = 0$: $-1 + a - b + 8 = 0$, so $a - b = -7$. Solving: From second equation $a = b - 7$. Substitute: $2(b-7) + b = -8$, giving $3b = 6$, so $b = 2$ and $a = -5$. Thus $a + b = -3$.

questions.question: Find the value of $k$ if $(x-1)$ is a factor of $kx^3 - 3x^2 + 5x - 3$.
Given that $P(x) = x^4 - 5x^3 + 5x^2 + 5x - 6$ and $P(1) = 0$, $P(2) = 0$. Which of the following are also factors of $P(x)$? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: We know $(x-1)(x-2)$ are factors. Test others: $P(3) = 81-135+45+15-6 = 0$ ✓. $P(-1) = 1+5+5-5-6 = 0$ ✓. So $(x-3)$ and $(x+1)$ are also factors.
